column2: Wait a minute, wait. You\xc2\x92re telling me this actress person is the\nonly woman you ever wanted who didn\xc2\x92t want you back?!'
Yeah! Oh my God! (to Chandler) Is this what it\xc2\x92s like to be you?'
Wow, you\xc2\x92re really crazy about her, huh?'

Oh, you have no idea. And-and when we\xc2\x92re on stage I get to-to kiss\nher and-and touch her, but then she goes home with the director, and it\xc2\x92s like\nsomebody\xc2\x92s ripping out my heart!'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s so great to see you feeling like this!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
Monica, uh Dad called this morning and ah, Aunt Silvia passed away.'
Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!'
We were all pretty shaken up about it.'
Wait, am I missing something though? \xc2\x91Cause I thought death was\nsomething that\xc2\x92s supposed to be sad, in a way.'
Well ah, Aunt Silvia was, well not a nice person.'
Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch! (Ross gives her a look) (to\nRoss) And I\xc2\x92m sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?'
You get the dollhouse.'
I get the dollhouse!'
Wow, a house for dolls, that is so cool! When I was kid, I had a barrel.'
Uh, Pheebs, you had a barrel for a dollhouse?'
No, just a barrel.'
Y'know what, you can play with my dollhouse."
Really?! Really?!'
Any time you want. Y'know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to\nplay with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with."
My Grandmother used to say that exact same thing to me.'
Hey, Sophie!'
Hey, Rach!'
Hey.'
Hey.'
Thanks for lunch, Chandler. Y'know, you didn\xc2\x92t have to walk me all\nthe way back up here."
Oh, that\xc2\x92s-that\xc2\x92s okay, no problem. (He starts to look\naround her office.)'
Honey um, honey, you do realise that we don\xc2\x92t keep the women\xc2\x92s\nlingerie here in the office?'
Yes, I realise that.'
Summer catalogue! (hands him the catalogue)'
That\xc2\x92s the stuff! (quickly grabs it)'
Rachel, I need the Versachi invoice. (to Chandler) Hello! You\ndon\xc2\x92t work for me.'
(introduces them) Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing (to Chandler)\nJoanna.'
Bing! That\xc2\x92s a great name.'
Thanks, it\xc2\x92s ah, Gaelic, for \xc2\x91Thy turkey\xc2\x92s done.\xc2\x92\nSo ah, I\xc2\x92m gonna go, nice, nice meeting you.'
Me too.'
Bye, Chandler.'
(to Rachel) So ah, what\xc2\x92s wrong with him?'
Oh, nothing, he\xc2\x92s just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice\nit anymore.'
Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?'
No!! No! He\xc2\x92s not married, or involved, with anyone!'
Oh, Rachel, (pause) actually, y'know what, forget it."
Well, I\xc2\x92ll ask him for you, if you want me too?'
Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and y'know something\nthat Sophie would do?"
Uh, uh, uh, I am here.'
I know that.'
Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpaper\xc2\x92s a little faded, that\xc2\x92s okay.\nCarpet\xc2\x92s a little loose. Hardwood floors!!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hello.'
Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It\xc2\x92s so beautiful.'
I know!!!'
So, I\xc2\x92m here, ready to play.'
Okay.'
I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha. (She\nremoves this large ceramic dog that comes up to the second floor and places it next to the\nhouse.)'
What\xc2\x92s this?'
That\xc2\x92s a dog, every house should have a dog.'
Not one that can pee on the roof.'
Well, maybe it\xc2\x92s so big because the house was built on radioactive\nwaste.'
(holding a tissue) And is this in case the house sneezes?'
No, no, that\xc2\x92s the ghost for the attic.'
I don\xc2\x92t want a ghost.'
Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you\xc2\x92ve got one, because the house\nis sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.'
Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient\nIndian burial ground? That would never happen.'
Okay, obviously you don\xc2\x92t know much about the U.S. government.'
(entering) Hey!'
Hello.'
I need to talk to you!'
Sure, what\xc2\x92s up?'
Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.'
I-I know. Well if something comes up... (walks away)'
Oh, I'm glad you guys are past that little awkward phase."
Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about\nyou...'
Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checkin\xc2\x92\nout the Chan-Chan man!'
(looks at him) That was (pause) surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you\ninterested at all?'
Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I\xc2\x92ll do it.'
Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she\xc2\x92s gonna love me.'
(holding a dinosaur) Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the\nhouse!! Ahh-ahh! (the dinosaur starts attacking the house. She starts to bark like a dog.)\nRoof! Rrroof-roof-roof!'

Okay, Phoebe, y'know what? That-that\xc2\x92s it, that\xc2\x92s it, all\nright? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They\xc2\x92re not the right size,\nthey\xc2\x92re not Victorian, and they just don\xc2\x92t go."
Okay, (starts to pack up her stuff) fine. Come dinosaur, we\xc2\x92re not\nwelcome in the house of no imagination.'
Uh, Pheebs, while we\xc2\x92re hovering around the subject. I just have to\nsay dinosaurs, they-they don\xc2\x92t go, rrroof!'
The little ones do.'
Hey, Kate!'
Morning.'
Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last\nweek...'
Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute! (she goes over to him)'
(to himself) And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was\ngood, yeah...'
Hi, oh, I\xc2\x92m Lauren, Kate\xc2\x92s understudy.'
Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.'
I know! I-I\xc2\x92m a big fan of yours.'
(looks at her, shocked) What?!'
I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Remoray on\nDays of Our Lives.'
Get out of here, really?!'
Absolutely!'
Yeah? '
Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.'
They gave me the shaft all right.'
(laughing) Oh, you\xc2\x92re so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing\nafter rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?'
Well Ahh, (he sees Kate and the director kissing) yeah! Yeah, sure, a\ndrink sounds great.'
Cool! I-I\xc2\x92ll see you then.'
All right.'
All right, it\xc2\x92s time to act, my talking props. (Both Joey and\nKate just look at each other.)'
Hey! '
Hey!'
Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!'
Wow!!'
Look, look! (She lifts up the roof, and the front panel falls revealing\nthe interior.)'
Hey, what\xc2\x92s this?!'
Oh, okay, it\xc2\x92s the slide instead of stairs. Watch this. (She slides\na doll down the slide)'
It\xc2\x92s very interesting, Phoebe.'
What\xc2\x92s this?'
The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come\nover, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.'
This is the coolest house ever!!'
Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room? (lights some\nincense)'
All right!'
I would!'
Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!'
Uh-huh.'
Watch, watch. (She turns a strand of Christmas lights strung around the\nhouse.)'
Ooohhhh!!'
And, and! (She turns on a bubble maker.)'
Ahhhh!!'
(entering) Hey, my Father\xc2\x92s house does that!'
(to Chandler) O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.'
Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there\xc2\x92s nothing\nlike a cool, crisp New York evening. '
Hmm.'
Of course, I didn\xc2\x92t get to enjoy any of that, because\nJoanna\xc2\x92s such a big, dull dud!'
Chandler is fantastic!!'
What?!'
Oh God, we just clicked! Y\xc2\x92know how people just click? Like he came\nby to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?'
Oh, and he\xc2\x92s got such a good heart! Doesn\xc2\x92t he have a good\nheart?'
Oh, I know...'
Oh, I know and he\xc2\x92s soo sweet! Listen, he said he was going to\ncall, so put him straight through.'
Isn\xc2\x92t this great?!'
Don\xc2\x92t spoil it.'
Come on baby, don\xc2\x92t go. Please? What do you say?'

(answering the phone) Hello. Oh! It\xc2\x92s you. Just ah, just
one-one sec. (to Joey and Kate) I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that
there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, committing
to the moment! (He goes to take the call.)'
(to Kate) That guy\xc2\x92s like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?'
He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater\nyou\xc2\x92re dating.'
Hey, I\xc2\x92m not interested in her sweater! It\xc2\x92s what\xc2\x92s\nunderneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who\nI\xc2\x92m going out with?'
I don\xc2\x92t care. Why, do you want me to care?'
Do you want me to want you to care?'
Do you?'
What?'
(returning) Okay, I\xc2\x92m afraid to say this, but let\xc2\x92s pick\nit up where we left off.'
Come on baby, don\xc2\x92t go. Please? What do you say?'
I\xc2\x92ve got no reason to stay. '
Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a\nterrible play! I\xc2\x92ll see you in the morning. (exits)'
I can\xc2\x92t believe we go on in, in a week.'
Hey, it\xc2\x92s gonna be all right.'
(to Joey) Hey! So since we\xc2\x92re getting off early, do you want to go\nand paint mugs?'
What?'
You know! At the place I told you about last night?'
Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah,\ny'know what, I think I kinda need to work on my stuff tonight."
Oh, okay.'
Okay. (he gives her a peck on the cheek)'
I\xc2\x92ll see you tomorrow. (she kisses him full on the mouth.)'
Okay.'
G\xc2\x92night. (exits)'
(to Kate) Ah, are you okay?'
Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we gonna do about this scene, huh?'
I don\xc2\x92t know.'
Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.'
How do you mean?'
Well, Adrian\xc2\x92s looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can\xc2\x92t\njust kiss her, he\xc2\x92s gotta, gotta really give her a reason, y'know?"
Maybe he could slip her the tongue.'
Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.'
Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his\nwaist.'
And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his\nstomach!'
And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and,\nand, and bite her!'
And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this\nraw, animal....'
Something like that?'
Yeah, that\xc2\x92s pretty much what I had in mind.'
Yeah.'
(to Ross) Hey.'
Hi.'
(to Monica) Hey. '
Hi.'
Hey.'
It\xc2\x92s a little early to be drinkin\xc2\x92.'
No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.'
Ohhhhh!'
You\xc2\x92re kidding?! That\xc2\x92s great!'
Oh, it was so amazing. After the (pause) love making...'
Oh my.'

Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in
and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming \xc2\x91cause, \xc2\x91cause her eyes keep
going like this. (He closes his eyes and moves them around, kinda like he\xc2\x92s been
processed by the devil, or something.)'
(entering with Rachel) I\xc2\x92m telling ya, Joanna\xc2\x92s got it all\nwrong. Okay? All I said was, \xc2\x91This was fun. Let\xc2\x92s do it again sometime.\nI\xc2\x92ll give you a call.\xc2\x92'
Ohh, gee. I wonder why she thinks you\xc2\x92re going to call her?'
That\xc2\x92s what you say at the end of a date.'
You can\xc2\x92t just say, \xc2\x91Nice to meet you, good night?\xc2\x92'

To her face? Look it\xc2\x92s the end of the date, I\xc2\x92m standing\nthere, I know all she\xc2\x92s waiting for is for me to say \xc2\x91I\xc2\x92ll call her\xc2\x92\nand it\xc2\x92s just y'know, comes out. I can\xc2\x92t help it, it\xc2\x92s a compulsion."
Come on Rach, when a guy says he\xc2\x92s going to call, it doesn\xc2\x92t\nmean he\xc2\x92s going to call. Hasn\xc2\x92t it ever happened to you?'
Well, they always called.'
Hmm, bite me.'
(entering) Did he call?'
No. Sorry.'
Why?! Why?! He said he\xc2\x92d call. Why hasn\xc2\x92t he called?'
Maybe he\xc2\x92s intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.'
Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn\xc2\x92t he\ncalled, Rachel? Why?'
Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you\nare my boss.'
Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?'
Well...'
The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn\xc2\x92t\ntell him not to call me, did you?'
Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you\nwork for, there are always ways to fix...that.'
(grabbing the magazine out of his hands) Call her! Call her now!'
Multiple, so many paper cuts.'
Why hasn\xc2\x92t he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don\xc2\x92t understand.\nWhy? He said he\xc2\x92ll call. Why? Why? Chandler I\xc2\x92m telling you she has flipped out,\nshe\xc2\x92s gone crazy!'
(sarcastic) Oh, well give me the phone then.'
Come on, this isn\xc2\x92t funny. She thinks it\xc2\x92s my fault that you\nhaven\xc2\x92t called her. You have to call her!'
Look, you can\xc2\x92t call somebody after this long just to say,\n\xc2\x91In case you didn\xc2\x92t notice, I don\xc2\x92t like you!\xc2\x92'
Well then you\xc2\x92re going to have to take her out again.'
Nooo!! She\xc2\x92s really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop\nthing in the corner of her eye!'

I don\xc2\x92t care! I don\xc2\x92t care! You are going to have to take her\nout again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it\xc2\x92s actually ended. And, I\ndon\xc2\x92t care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!'
All right! Fine! But it\xc2\x92s just a lunch date, no more than an\nhour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don\xc2\x92t want you setting me up with anybody\never again!'
That\xc2\x92s fine!'
That\xc2\x92s just a lot of big talk, y'know."
I know.'
Mon?'
(from the bathroom) I\xc2\x92m in the shower!'
Oh, fire! There, there\xc2\x92s a fire! Fire!!'
Hey.'
Hi.'
So I ah, talked to Lauren, kinda told her how things were with us. Did you\nah, did you talk to Marshall?'
About what?'
Y'know, about what happened with us."
Nooo. And there\xc2\x92s really no reason he should find out, so ah\nlet\xc2\x92s not make a big deal about it, okay?'
What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you\ncan\xc2\x92t tell me last night didn\xc2\x92t mean something to you. I-I was there,\nyou\xc2\x92re not that good an actress.'

Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That\xc2\x92s all it\nwas. Joey, I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m sorry you feel bad, but haven\xc2\x92t you ever sleep with a\nwomen where it meant more to her than it did to you?'
Nooo.'
(entering) Hi, Kate!'
Hi, Lauren.'
Hi, Lauren.'
Hi, pig!'
Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower\nmassager.'
Yeah.'
(entering) Hey!'
(runs over to her) I tried to reach you at work. There\xc2\x92s....been a\nfire.'
What?! Oh my... (sees the remains of the house) Oh my God!! What\nhappened?!'
Well, we believe it originated here. (He uses a pointer and points to the\npoint of origin.) In the Aroma Room.'
All right. Did everyone get out okay?'
Well, the giraffe\xc2\x92s okay. And so is the pirate.'
Ohh. What is this? (She sees a tissue covering something, and moves to\nremove it.)'
No Phoebe, don\xc2\x92t look! You don\xc2\x92t want to see what\xc2\x92s under\nthere!!'
(She pauses to ready herself, and removes the tissue.) Ohh, the-the\nFoster puppets! '
It\xc2\x92s not a big deal. It\xc2\x92s, just it\xc2\x92s right here,\n(points to his eye) and it\xc2\x92s all the time.'
Well, thanks again for lunch.'
(He looks over at Rachel, who nods her head) Yes, this, this was\npleasant.'
It was, wasn\xc2\x92t it?'
The food there was, was great.'
Wasn\xc2\x92t it?'
So take care.'
You too.'
Well, this was great. I\xc2\x92ll give you a call. We should do it again\nsometime. (Rachel is disappointed) '
Great! I\xc2\x92m looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?'
Sophie\xc2\x92s desk.'
(whispering) Chandler!! Are you gonna call her!'
Noo! '
Chandler!!'
Look, I\xc2\x92m sorry. Okay? I\xc2\x92m weak, and pathetic, and sorry.'
Okay, you are going to tell her and you\xc2\x92re going to tell her now.\n(She grabs his nipple and starts to twist it.)'
Ahhhh\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92m not going to call you.'
What?'

I\xc2\x92m sorry. I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m sorry that I said I was
going to when I\xc2\x92m not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, y'know? And this
isn\xc2\x92t Rachel\xc2\x92s fault. It\xc2\x92s me. I have serious, serious problems when it
comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy, (pause) mascara goop. And
I\xc2\x92m really sorry, it\xc2\x92s just that this is not, this isn\xc2\x92t going to work out."
Well, this isn\xc2\x92t how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I\nhave to appreciate your honesty.'
Yeah, o-okay.'
Well this is great! I\xc2\x92ll give you a call! We should do it again\nsometime!'

(on phone) Well, so anyway Beth, what I\xc2\x92m saying is I should\xc2\x92ve
considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I\xc2\x92ve ah, I\xc2\x92ve
recently learned what\xc2\x92s it like to be on your side of it, and I\xc2\x92m sorry. So, do
you think you can forgive me? (listens) Great. Thanks. Okay, bye. (He sits down and
crosses out something, and dials the phone again.) Hello, Jennifer? (listens) Oh hi, Mrs.
Loreo, is Jennifer there? (listens) Oh, she\xc2\x92s not home huh? (listens) Well ah,
actually I kinda need to talk to you too.'
